newsitem.title: USA: Paper stocks strong on steady price.
newsitem.headline: Paper stocks strong on steady price.

text.p: Paper stocks rallied across the board on Wednesday afternoon as lumber prices held steady, much to the surprise of industry observers, analysts said.

Georgia-Pacific Corp was up 1-1/8 at 75-1/8, International Paper Co was up 1/2 at 40-5/8, Champion International Corp was up 5/8 at 43-7/8, Potlatch Corp was up 1-1/8 at 38-1/4, Weyerhaeuser Co was up 3/4 at 45-1/2, Boise Cascade Corp 5/8 at 34-1/4 and James River Corp was up 1/2 at 26-3/8.
"Lumber prices are holding above where they were in the second quarter which surprised most industry observers," said Michael Metz, chief investment strategist at Oppenheimer & Co.
He added that there was anecdotal evidence that exports to Asia and Latin America were stronger than expected.

Lumber dealers let inventories run low this summer in anticipation of lower lumber prices. Instead prices stayed firm and an unusual late-season building surge had dealers scrambling for wood to supply homebuilders.
